Topic.Title: Obama steps on his tounge again.

Message.Msg: Thank you, Pepeek... Teddy Roosevelrt and unions helped create the middle class in our country. We'd still be in the hands of the robber barons of the 1800s - extreme abject poverty all around. No child labor laws - no education - no work safety laws - no work hours limits - no benefits - no paid into retirement. Poverty has risen again in USA over 40% higher in the past 30 years while the wealthy have become even wealthier. Gap has widened tremendously. Wealthy greed has no limits once again. Look at big oil, huge corporate farms, big pharma, insurance, Wall St. banks and insurance cos. have run wild as a result of many many deregulations since Ronald Reagan. Unbelieveable greed - never seen since the 1800s and of course the greedy party during the 1920s. We see how these excesses and wild parties ended in all instances since the 1800s. Huge depressions in the 1800s and 1920s. Learn from history. Toynbee was right; if we do not learn from it we are doomed to repeat its mistakes! Good luck to all.

Topic.Title: ATT is doing NOK and MSFT a disservice

Message.Msg: My local ATT corporate store got 2 Nokia 920s in yellow when they came out from corporate. 2....yes 2. I've been waiting 6 weeks for my yellow 920 ordered at the store while you listen to a 20 year old tell you Nokia doesn't keep up with Android or Apple phones. Does an iPhone 5 have wireless charging? No. Floating lenses so you can video without shake, no. Apple have free Mix Radio that let's you listen to music programmed by real people, no. Does Apple have a screen you can see outside better than Nokia, no. Apple work with my windows computer, no. My Xbox ,no. I have never seen a more pathetic rollout without store support for we windows computer users who are the largest group in the world. 2 yellow 920s ...please. I'm a baby boomer with money and we used to use Nokia at ATT until ATT pulled Nokia for coming out with WiFi. Just tell us baby boomers you don't want our business ATT but quit giving us the finger at your stores, the unemployed 20 year olds will bail you out. I can cancel my contract at the snap of a finger.

Topic.Title: Obama steps on his tounge again.

Message.Msg: "Obama goes out of his way to praise the teachers unions and the teachers in Detroit and then his Department of Education publishes data that say only 7% of the 8th graders in Detroit public schools are able to read at their grade level" I didn't reply to the specifics because it is so stupid. These are unrelated dots you connect. It has nothing to do with Union teachers, the data. Union teachers are experienced and best. You get a new roof, you call an experienced firm, or led a kid with a how to book do the job? Teaching is one of the most difficult and taxing jobs there is. Obama was right on praising them, as we all should be. I do. I give teachers the highest praises. Teachers do not have time to go home with each child, and with the large size classes, there is only so much teacher for each child. You are really off base on the whole thing. Their pay is very low in the early years, so low they barely get by. When are you going to thank all the thousands of Union employes for your present day job conditions? You just think that happened by chance? Read some history of the labor movement and about the working conditions 100 years ago. You want that, just to be against Obama? It serves no purpose to harp on Obama, every day making up a new story on hiis wrong doings.
